query: 什么是安省法文大学的历史？

answers.text: 在2010年后，安大略省中部和西南部出现了促进建立以法语为教学语言的大学的活动。包括安省法语人大会（英语：Francophone Assembly of Ontario）（Francophone Assembly of Ontario）在内的多个安大略法语及法裔团体发布了一份报告，建议于2014年10月3日在该地区建立一所法语大学。2015年5月26日，在安大略省省议会有议员提出建立法语大学的私人议案。然而，由于议会休会，该法案未能通过。在议会休会期间，安大略省中部和西南部的法文专上教育谘询委员会发布了一份报告指出，安大略省中部和西南部的法文专上教育资源不足，并建议在大多伦多地区建立一所法语大学以帮助解决问题。在议会重开后，有关的私人法令草案于2016年9月21日再度被提出。9月22日，议会成立了一个计划委员会来帮助建立该大学，其中包括联邦前官方语言专员；来自其他位于多伦多的大学的成员（包括怀雅逊大学和多伦多大学）；省级法语公共广播公司TFO的总裁；以及来自其他安大略省法语及法裔组织的成员。建立该大学的法例《2017年安省法文大学法令》（Université de l'Ontario français Act, 2017）于2017年12月14日通过，并于2018年4月9日正式生效。Normand Labrie于2018年7月4日被委任为该大学的临时校长；并担任该职位直到2020年8月，随之华安卓（André Roy）担任该大学的第一任正式的校长。2021年2月，华安卓因个人原因于2月与两位副校长Denis Berthiaume和Édith Dumont一同辞职，仅担任大学临时校长一职。校董会成员于2018年12月31日委任。然而，在2018年安大略省大选之后，新组建的进步保守党政府宣布取消资助建立法文大学的计划。贾斯汀·杜鲁多、安省法语人大会（英语：Francophone Assembly of Ontario）及魁北克省省长弗朗索瓦·勒戈（Francois Legault）皆对此表示失望。法文大学资金问题一度成为安省新政府与法裔安大略人之间的主要政治矛盾。2018年11月29日，省议会的法裔议员施玛德（Amanda Simard）宣布退出进步保守党，转为无党籍议员（后于2020年1月16日加入自由党）。她称政府取消法文大学的资助是她做出此决定的原因之一。2018年12月，安省逾万法语人士上街抗议省政府削减法语开支。2019年9月，安大略省政府和加拿大联邦政府宣布已签署谅解备忘录，两级政府宣布将在接下来的八年内提供1.26亿加元的资金以资助法文大学。安省法文大学于2019年9月开设了第一个学术项目，这是一个针对城市书院（Collège La Cité）教育学学生的专上教育教育学项目。该大学为完成该项目的教育学学生颁发了大学成立以来第一批研究生毕业证书。该大学随即计划于2021年秋季招收第一批全日制学生。2021年1月24日，大学表示仅收到19名申请人的入学申请，远低于预期的200名申请人。大学第一批全日制本科生于2021年9月开课，共有151名学生。

answer_list.answer_sentence: 在2010年后，安大略省中部和西南部出现了促进建立以法语为教学语言的大学的活动。
包括安省法语人大会（英语：Francophone Assembly of Ontario）（Francophone Assembly of Ontario）在内的多个安大略法语及法裔团体发布了一份报告，建议于2014年10月3日在该地区建立一所法语大学。
2015年5月26日，在安大略省省议会有议员提出建立法语大学的私人议案。
然而，由于议会休会，该法案未能通过。
在议会休会期间，安大略省中部和西南部的法文专上教育谘询委员会发布了一份报告指出，安大略省中部和西南部的法文专上教育资源不足，并建议在大多伦多地区建立一所法语大学以帮助解决问题。
9月22日，议会成立了一个计划委员会来帮助建立该大学，其中包括联邦前官方语言专员；来自其他位于多伦多的大学的成员（包括怀雅逊大学和多伦多大学）；省级法语公共广播公司TFO的总裁；以及来自其他安大略省法语及法裔组织的成员。
建立该大学的法例《2017年安省法文大学法令》（Université de l'Ontario français Act, 2017）于2017年12月14日通过，并于2018年4月9日正式生效。
在议会重开后，有关的私人法令草案于2016年9月21日再度被提出。
建立该大学的法例《2017年安省法文大学法令》（Université de l'Ontario français Act, 2017）于2017年12月14日通过，并于2018年4月9日正式生效。
建立该大学的法例《2017年安省法文大学法令》（Université de l'Ontario français Act, 2017）于2017年12月14日通过，并于2018年4月9日正式生效。
然而，在2018年安大略省大选之后，新组建的进步保守党政府宣布取消资助建立法文大学的计划。
Normand Labrie于2018年7月4日被委任为该大学的临时校长；。
并担任该职位直到2020年8月，随之华安卓（André Roy）担任该大学的第一任正式的校长。
2021年2月，华安卓因个人原因于2月与两位副校长Denis Berthiaume和Édith Dumont一同辞职，仅担任大学临时校长一职。
校董会成员于2018年12月31日委任。
然而，在2018年安大略省大选之后，新组建的进步保守党政府宣布取消资助建立法文大学的计划。
贾斯汀·杜鲁多、安省法语人大会（英语：Francophone Assembly of Ontario）及魁北克省省长弗朗索瓦·勒戈（Francois Legault）皆对此表示失望。
法文大学资金问题一度成为安省新政府与法裔安大略人之间的主要政治矛盾。
2018年11月29日，省议会的法裔议员施玛德（Amanda Simard）宣布退出进步保守党，转为无党籍议员（后于2020年1月16日加入自由党）。
她称政府取消法文大学的资助是她做出此决定的原因之一。
2019年9月，安大略省政府和加拿大联邦政府宣布已签署谅解备忘录，两级政府宣布将在接下来的八年内提供1.26亿加元的资金以资助法文大学。
该大学随即计划于2021年秋季招收第一批全日制学生。
2018年12月，安省逾万法语人士上街抗议省政府削减法语开支。
安省法文大学于2019年9月开设了第一个学术项目，这是一个针对城市书院（Collège La Cité）教育学学生的专上教育教育学项目。
该大学为完成该项目的教育学学生颁发了大学成立以来第一批研究生毕业证书。
2021年1月24日，大学表示仅收到19名申请人的入学申请，远低于预期的200名申请人。
大学第一批全日制本科生于2021年9月开课，共有151名学生。

f723198f967a80e257d5c94253ea413a.content: Ford and Trudeau governments team up to establish new Francophone university January 22, 2020TORONTO — The governments of Ontario and Canada are teaming up to support the first French-language university governed by and for Ontario Francophones. The two levels of government will split a $126-million investment in the Université de l’Ontario français over the next eight years. Cabinet ministers with the Ford government and the Trudeau came together today to ink the funding agreement in support of the new university, which will be located in Toronto. “We are delighted to achieve this historic milestone and to welcome, as planned, the first cohorts in the fall 2021,” said Dyane Adam, Chair of the Board of Governors for Université de l’Ontario français. “I want to thank the provincial and federal governments for their leadership and support and look forward to welcoming Ontario’s Francophone students to the Université de l’Ontario français.”“We are excited to be able to move forward with full implementation of the Université de l’Ontario français,” said Ross Romano, Ontario’s Minister of Colleges and Universities, adding the Ford government “has always been committed to the university and to supporting access to the education and training needed for rewarding careers and meeting labour market demands for Ontario’s Francophone students.”“This is an historic day for Franco-Ontarians and Francophones all across Canada,” said Mélanie Joly, federal Minister of Economic Development and Official Languages. “It is an unprecedented step that will make a difference in the lives of thousands of Canadians who will now have the opportunity to pursue higher education in French here in Ontario and will unite francophones from all regions of our country.”The newly signed agreement follows up a September 2019 Memorandum of Understanding between the two governments on establishing the school. 9209cbe9353a01286e53633936c9148a.content: Université de l'Ontario français: Changes to the Executive Leadership's officeFrançaisNews provided byUniversité de l'Ontario français (UOF)Feb 01, 2021, 16:00 ETShare this article Share this articleTORONTO, Feb. 1, 2021 /CNW Telbec/ - The Board of Governors of Université de l'Ontario français (UOF) regrets to announce the resignation of UOF President André Roy for personal reasons. With his departure, the Board has decided to temporarily reorganize the Executive Leadership's office to ensure that operations are maintained, and that the University is ready to welcome the first cohort of students in September 2021. Effective immediately, Professor Denis Berthiaume, Vice-president Studies and Research, and Édith Dumont, Vice-president Partnerships, Communities, and International Relations, will share responsibility for interim leadership of the University. Jean-Luc Bernard will continue as Executive Director and Chief Accountability Officer. This leadership team has been with UOF for several months now and will be stepping in to work with the rest of the Executive Leadership's office as staff continue to be hired to manage the University's professional and academic activities. They will also continue to reach out to students to highlight the advantages of earning a university degree at the innovative French-language institution opening this 2021 academic year. In addition, they will oversee the UOF's administrative requirements, including implementing state-of-the-art digital and business networks and finalizing the fit-up of its new Toronto campus. Université de l'Ontario français is open for businessWith only a few weeks before the first cohort of students arrive in 2021, the admissions process is still ongoing and efforts are intensifying to recruit students from French-language secondary schools in Ontario as well as from francophone communities across Canada, including Quebec, and abroad. ae1c21ebf6a7e617b424d3482a73b969.content: Ford and Trudeau governments team up to establish new Francophone university January 22, 2020TORONTO — The governments of Ontario and Canada are teaming up to support the first French-language university governed by and for Ontario Francophones. The two levels of government will split a $126-million investment in the Université de l’Ontario français over the next eight years. Cabinet ministers with the Ford government and the Trudeau came together today to ink the funding agreement in support of the new university, which will be located in Toronto. “We are delighted to achieve this historic milestone and to welcome, as planned, the first cohorts in the fall 2021,” said Dyane Adam, Chair of the Board of Governors for Université de l’Ontario français. “I want to thank the provincial and federal governments for their leadership and support and look forward to welcoming Ontario’s Francophone students to the Université de l’Ontario français.”“We are excited to be able to move forward with full implementation of the Université de l’Ontario français,” said Ross Romano, Ontario’s Minister of Colleges and Universities, adding the Ford government “has always been committed to the university and to supporting access to the education and training needed for rewarding careers and meeting labour market demands for Ontario’s Francophone students.”“This is an historic day for Franco-Ontarians and Francophones all across Canada,” said Mélanie Joly, federal Minister of Economic Development and Official Languages. “It is an unprecedented step that will make a difference in the lives of thousands of Canadians who will now have the opportunity to pursue higher education in French here in Ontario and will unite francophones from all regions of our country.”The newly signed agreement follows up a September 2019 Memorandum of Understanding between the two governments on establishing the school. The parties say they see it as affirming their commitment ...
ae1c21ebf6a7e617b424d3482a73b969.description: 麦克唐纳所在的康沃尔市曾希望主办这所学校，但今天的声明否定了这一想法。各党表示，他们认为这是对“满足安大略省62万多法语人口需求”的承诺的肯定。“安大略法语大学是一个重要的、期待已久的项目，对法语-安大略人的后代至关重要，”该省法语事务部长卡罗琳·马尔罗尼说。“这所新大学是我们政府致力于加强法语社区、投资于其未来并确保社区继续为安大略省的繁荣做出贡献的一个很好的例子。”“我们的未来取决于为安大略省法语学生提供尽可能最好的教育，他们中的许多人就住在我们的骑行区。福特和特鲁多政府联手建立新的法语大学2020年1月22日多伦多——安大略省和加拿大政府联手支持第一所由安大略省法语国家管理并为其服务的法语大学。两级政府将在未来八年内对法国安大略大学进行1.26亿美元的投资。

7a6ea09cdcb7048ff531ff5190b8692e.content: After much pushback and protest kept Universite de l'Ontario Francais alive, the new French language school has only received 19 applications from Ontario students as of Jan. 17.Vice-rector Denis Berthiaume confirmed that the University has also received around 20 additional admission requests from abroad or from adults who are considering a return to school. That brings the total number of requests received so far to 39.Rector André Roy had previously said the school's goal was to have 200 students for its first semester, which is scheduled to begin this September.Admission applications can still be submitted, but Jan. 17 was the first deadline in the university calendar across the province.The applications also don't mean that students will necessarily choose the university, which is located in downtown Toronto, if they are admitted, as students can apply for admission to multiple programs.Berthiaume told Radio-Canada that the start of the school year will go ahead as planned in September, no matter the number of confirmed students.He also said that courses will meet any student needs, whether in person or virtually, if circumstances require."Faculty teams are being recruited, the building is being finished, so everything will be ready," he said.Other universities, like Guelph, Brock and some Western University campuses, have also experienced a decrease in the number of admissions received this year compared to 2020.The Université de Hearst, another Franco-Ontarian institution that is affiliated with Laurentian University, received 17 applications, which is half the number of last year.It's been a rocky road for Universite de l'Ontario Francais. The project was first announced under Kathleen Wynne's Liberal government, but after Doug Ford's Progressive Conservative government was elected, it was nixed.The province reversed that decision following protests from Franco-Ontarians and extended talks with the federal government.An agreement reached between the federal and provincial governments in 2019 provides funding of $126 million ...
